indieProjects.name: Poker AI: HomeStack

features.title: Statistics & Trends

architecture: Built with Expo managed workflow for rapid iteration and over-the-air updates
Implemented offline-first architecture using AsyncStorage and sync queues
Modular component architecture with atomic design principles
Custom hook system for business logic separation and reusability
performance: Optimized FlatList rendering for 10,000+ hand history with virtualization
Implemented React.memo and useMemo strategically to prevent unnecessary re-renders
Used react-native-reanimated for 60fps animations on charts and transitions
Lazy loaded heavy screens and components to reduce initial bundle size
deployment: Set up EAS Build for cloud-based iOS and Android builds
Configured over-the-air updates with Expo Updates for instant bug fixes
Implemented staged rollouts to test updates with small user groups first
Automated App Store and Play Store submission process with Fastlane
tradeoffs: Chose Expo managed workflow for faster development over bare React Native for maximum control
Used Firebase instead of custom backend to focus on mobile experience and ship faster
Implemented client-side analytics calculations to reduce backend costs (trade: slower initial load)
Limited offline functionality to core features to reduce complexity
challenges: Handling edge cases in hand history parsing and validation
Optimizing chart rendering performance with large datasets
Managing app state across offline/online transitions
Balancing feature richness with app size constraints for mobile
learnings: Importance of designing for offline-first from day one
Value of comprehensive error boundaries and crash reporting (Sentry)
Mobile users expect instant feedback - optimistic updates are critical
App Store review process requires patience and attention to guidelines
